title: The real tragedy of Grenfell is that it was an avoidable disaster
text:
The official report into the emergency service response to the Grenfell Tower disaster, which this newspaper has seen, makes grim reading for the London Fire Brigade (LFB). A relatively minor blaze caused by a faulty fridge freezer in the kitchen of one flat turned into a conflagration that engulfed the entire high-rise building and killed 72 residents.

But while the fire spread rapidly because of the cladding on the outside of the tower block, many people might have survived had they not been told to stay in their homes rather than flee. The inquiry chaired by Sir Martin Moore-Bick praises the firefighters attending the scene for their “extraordinary courage and selfless devotion to duty”. But...
